Job Posting:171639 - Position: F25 Front-End Developer Co-op 171639B E1 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Fall App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 08/11/2025 11:59 PM Through Employer Website 07/30/2025 03:08 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country GoodMorning #900-9707, 110 Street NW Edmonton T5K 2L9 AB Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode 2025 - Fall F25 Front-End Developer Co-op 171639B E1 Co-op Position Edmonton, AB Canada 4 months To be confirmed Salary Currency CAD Salary Job Description 0.0 per hour for 0 Major List GoodMorning.com is a Canadian pioneer in the creation and growth of award-winning direct-to-consumer brands. Over the last decade, we have delivered hundreds of thousands of beloved products to customers across North America. And we've created an exciting, ownership-driven culture perfectly suited to intelligent, results-driven individuals. If you're hungry to disrupt stale consumer industries - with innovative new brands and products of exceptional value that customers love - then GoodMorning.com is the place for you. Description A creative designer and skilled front end web developer who utilizes current technologies to create beautiful and engaging websites that convert and satisfy the needs of our customers in the realm of e-commerce and publication properties. Responsibilities: • Working with stakeholders and other developers to ensure that project requirements relating to digital products are thoroughly specified • Producing low-fidelity wireframes, conversion-focused mockups, and responsive cross-platform-tested final designs • Planning, designing, writing, modifying, integrating, and testing HTML/CSS • Utilizing PHP to build complex front-end web layouts in which content and design have been decoupled • Building and customizing client side UI components using Vue (or similar frameworks), often leveraging an existing component library to accelerate development and ensure consistency • Delivering a high volume of design projects on time, within budget, and in accordance with project and company objectives • Adhering to design best practices to ensure incredible quality and error-free production of digital products according to brief • Collaborating with the systems team in creating and implementing digital solutions for our web properties Testing work product across various media to ensure objectives are met • Job Requirements Post-secondary degree or diploma in web design in progress Requirements: • • Possess a deep passion for web design and delivering an optimal user experience • Experience with HTML, CSS, and content management systems (like WordPress) • PHP (WordPress/WooCommerce) and JavaScript experience preferred, or a willingness to learn • Familiarity with at least one modern JavaScript framework (such as Vue, React, or Svelte) will be considered a strong asset - or a demonstrated interest in learning one • Firm understanding of version control in both theory and practice • Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite and other creative tools Proficiency with building mobile-friendly designs and web-optimized creative assets • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Yes Address Cover Letter to Hiring Manager Special Application Instructions Application Link: https://workforcenow.adp.com/mascsr/default/mdf/recruitment/recruitment.html?cid=0fb7ffda-7b9a-4ad7-ba86- b82d9e128c80&ccId=19000101_000001&lang=en_CA&selectedMenuKey=CurrentOpenings&jobId=575970&source=LI Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
